text: Tottenham Hale , is a National Rail and London Underground Victoria Line station in Tottenham, north London. It is on Hale Road near the Tottenham Hale one-way system. The station is in Travelcard Zone 3. The station opened on 15 September 1840 as Tottenham. It was on the Northern & Eastern Railway (N&ER;) line from Stratford in east London to Broxbourne in Hertfordshire. It was renamed Tottenham Hale on 1 September 1968 when it became an interchange station with London Underground on the opening of the first stage of the Victoria line. == Gallery == File:Tottenham Hale stn Victoria line southbound.JPG|Southbound Victoria line platform looking north File:Tottenham Hale Victoria line Northbound platform.jpg|Northbound Victoria line platform with train departing File:Tottenham Hale stn Victoria line roundel.JPG|Roundel on Victoria Line platform File:Tottenham Hale stn mainline northbound.JPG|Mainline platforms looking north == References == == Other websites == *London's Transport Museum Photographic Archive ** ** Category:Railway stations in the London Borough of Haringey Category:Railway stations opened in 1840 Category:Railway stations served by National Express East Anglia Category:Tottenham Category:Tube stations in the London Borough of Haringey Category:Victoria line stations Category:1840 establishments in England
title: Tottenham Hale station
